main_text:
Varieties of Perceptual Learning
2. Varieties of Perceptual Learning

The psychology literature provides ample evidence of perceptual
learning. Goldstone (1998) helpfully distinguishes between four
different types of perceptual learning in the literature:
differentiation, unitization, attentional weighting, and stimulus
imprinting. This section surveys these four types of perceptual
learning (for further review, see Goldstone 2003; Goldstone,
Braithwaite, & Byrge 2012; and Goldstone & Byrge 2015).
hierarchy_title: Perceptual Learning || Varieties of Perceptual Learning
